entry.value:
# libraries required%%00010library(plotly)%%00010%%00010# data input%%00010data <- knime.in%%00010%%00010dataset_1 <- data[,(1:(ncol(data)/2))]%%00010dataset_2 <- data[,((ncol(data)/2+1):ncol(data))]%%00010%%00010# changing uniform colnames for both datasets%%00010list <- trimws(strsplit(knime.flow.in[["colnames_violins"]],',')[[1]])%%00010colnames(dataset_1) <- list%%00010colnames(dataset_2) <- list%%00010%%00010# adding one column with the information about dataframe legend%%00010list_legend <- trimws(strsplit(knime.flow.in[["legend"]],',')[[1]])%%00010dataset_1$legend <- list_legend[[1]]%%00010dataset_2$legend <- list_legend[[2]]%%00010%%00010#str(dataset_1)%%00010#str(dataset_2)%%00010%%00010# merging both datasets so the dataset 2 is appended on the bottom of dataset 1%%00010data_all <- rbind(dataset_1, dataset_2) %%00010#str(data_all)%%00010%%00010# changing wide data format to long data format requried for plotting%%00010data_long <- reshape(data_all,%%00010%%00009%%00009%%00009%%00009 direction = "long",%%00010%%00009%%00009%%00009%%00009 varying = list, %%00010%%00009%%00009%%00009%%00009 v.names = "intensity",%%00010%%00009%%00009%%00009%%00009 # id.var = c("type", "number"),%%00010%%00009%%00009%%00009%%00009 timevar = "treatment",%%00010%%00009%%00009%%00009%%00009 times = list)%%00010#str(data_long)%%00010%%00010# changing the legend and treatment columns from character to factor%%00010data_long$legend <- as.factor(data_long$legend)%%00010data_long$treatment <- as.factor(data_long$treatment)%%00010%%00010# plotting violins%%00010pom <- knime.flow.in[["plot_save"]]%%00010%%00010knime.flow.in[["plot_save"]] <- data_long %>%%%00010 plot_ly(type = 'violin') %>%%%00010 add_trace(%%00010 x = ~treatment[data_long$legend== list_legend[[1]]],%%00010 y = ~intensity[data_long$legend== list_legend[[1]]],%%00010 legendgroup = list_legend[[1]],%%00010 scalegroup = list_legend[[1]],%%00010 name = list_legend[[1]],%%00010 side = 'negative',%%00010 box = list(%%00010 visible = T%%00010 ),%%00010 meanline = list(%%00010 visible = T%%00010 ),%%00010 line = list(%%00010 color = knime.flow.in[["color_left"]]%%00010 )%%00010 ) %>%%%00010 add_trace(%%00010 x = ~treatment[data_long$legend == list_legend[[2]]],%%00010 y = ~intensity[data_long$legend == list_legend[[2]]],%%00010 legendgroup = list_legend[[2]],%%00010 scalegroup = list_legend[[2]],%%00010 name = list_legend[[2]],%%00010 side = 'positive',%%00010 box = list(%%00010 visible = T%%00010 ),%%00010 meanline = list(%%00010 visible = T%%00010 ),%%00010 line = list(%%00010 color = knime.flow.in[["color_right"]]%%00010 )%%00010 ) %>% %%00010 layout(%%00010 title = paste("Violin plot (splitted, interactive)
", knime.flow.in[["graph_title"]]),%%00010 xaxis = list(%%00010 title = knime.flow.in[["x_axis_label"]],%%00010 type = 'category'%%00010 ),%%00010 yaxis = list(%%00010 title = knime.flow.in[["y_axis_label"]],%%00010 zeroline = F%%00010 ),%%00010 violingap = 0,%%00010 violingroupgap = 0,%%00010 violinmode = 'overlay'%%00010 )%%00010%%00010knime.flow.in[["plot_save"]]%%00010%%00010# plot saving%%00010# checks if user provided .html or not, if not, it will automatically append it to the name of file-to-be-saved%%00010if (grepl(".html", pom, fixed=TRUE) == TRUE) {%%00010 %%00009f1 <- paste(knime.flow.in[["plot_path"]],pom, sep="", collapse = NULL)%%00010} else {%%00010%%00009f <- paste(pom,".html", sep="",collapse = NULL)%%00010%%00009f1 <- paste(knime.flow.in[["plot_path"]],f, sep="", collapse = NULL)%%00010}%%00010%%00010htmlwidgets::saveWidget(as.widget(knime.flow.in[["plot_save"]]), f1, selfcontained=FALSE)%%00010%%00010# output is the original dataframe%%00010knime.out <- data%%00010

entry.key: Output non numbers (NaN, Inf, -Inf) as missing cells
